intro: Lisianthius seemannii, commonly known as the Cape fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The flowers are pollinated by birds, particularly sunbirds, making it an important plant in local ecosystems.
